document_title: Ventricular tachycardia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
MSc.BSc.CKI Vu Xuan Quang said that there are many causes that cause or contribute to problems with arrhythmia and ventricular tachycardia such as: (3)
Previous myocardial infarction or other heart disease that causes scarring of heart tissue (structural heart disease);; Poor blood flow to the heart muscle due to coronary artery disease;; Arrhythmias due to abnormal ion channels of the heart (such as long QT, short QT, Brugada...);; Imbalance of electrolytes (such as potassium, magnesium...);; Side effects of medications;; A family history of tachycardia or other arrhythmias makes a person more likely to develop ventricular tachycardia;; Sometimes, the exact cause of ventricular tachycardia cannot be determined (idiopathic ventricular tachycardia).
Patients with ventricular tachycardia need to be counseled and treated appropriately depending on the cause of the disease and avoid factors that trigger dangerous ventricular tachycardia.
